text:
Fashion & Beauty The best spring blushers 
Step up your spring beauty game with a brightening blusher. Here are our favourites to sweep away those dull winter days Wednesday 22 March 2017 11:54 GMT Click to follow 1/11 Scroll to see our edit of the best spring blushers... Shutterstock / Olga Kudryashova 2/11 English Mineral Makeup Blush and Contour in Bubblegum 
A richly pigmented and highly buildable powder from natural cosmetics brand English Mineral Makeup, this one will make your cheeks pop in just one sweep. It’s long-wearing and lasts throughout the day, making it a great choice for when you won’t have time to touch up your makeup. It comes complete with an ultra-soft kabuki brush, which is gentle on skin and comes in a handy bag size. Best for medium skin tones. £25, English Mineral Makeup, Buy it now 3/11 Benefit Dandelion Dew Liquid Blush 
For a dewy finish, look no further than this sheer cream blush from the drool-worthy Benefit Cosmetics range. It comes in a soft pink shade and can be worn alone or under a powder blusher. You might recognise its scent from the brand’s popular Dandelion face powder, which works perfectly on top of this. It’s beautiful on most skin tones and looks the most natural – so is perfect for your everyday capsule beauty collection. £24.50, Benefit Cosmetics, Buy it now 4/11 Clarins Multi-Blush in Rose 
If you prefer the ease of applying blush with your fingers, then this one is for you. The creamy Multi-Blush goes on like a dream and dries down to a soft powdery finish. With ingredients like jojoba, sunflower and mimosa wax, it’s a safe bet for dehydrated skin and comes in an array of subtle to deep shades. Sweep on a small amount to the apple of your cheek and work upwards along the cheekbone in a circular motion. £18.50, John Lewis, Buy it now 5/11 Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic in Love Is The Drug 
This two-step blush from world-renowned makeup artist, Charlotte Tilbury, is a blend of finely crushed pearls and colour-rich pigments that can be built up to create a healthy glow. It features a light yellow-based pink on the outer, perfect for defining cheeks, and a medium rose-pink shade in the centre for a gorgeous pop of colour. Not only does it help you achieve flushed cheeks, but also offers a luminous glow – thanks to the addition of ‘Light Flex Technology’, which captures light and re-emits it. £30, Charlotte Tilbury, Buy it now 6/11 Diego Dalla Palma Shade of Rose Blush N°76 
With five shades of pink ranging from dark to light, this powder compact from Italian cosmetics brand Diego Dalla Palma is a must for blush beginners. The smooth, fragrance-free blush provides an instant pick-me-up and beautifully defines cheeks. Its blend of tones means it will flatter different skin tones and can be used to create both soft and intense makeup looks. £29.90, Diego Dalla Palma, Buy it now 7/11 bareMinerals Blush in Vintage Peach 
A great choice for those with sensitive and acne-prone skin, this silky formula is made up of nourishing natural ingredients and sparkly pigments. The delicate ‘Vintage Peach’ shade is ideal for building up a natural looking colour – always start with a little. This one applies best with an angled blush brush. £20, Bare Minerals, Buy it now 8/11 Nars Blush in Orgasm 
Here’s a cult blush you’ll find in the makeup bags of several celebs including Victoria Beckham and Jennifer Lopez – and it’s easy to see why. An iconic shade and Nars best-seller, the peachy-pink Orgasm complements various skin tones and stays put for hours on end. It has subtle golden shimmer, which works with the colour to immediately enliven the complexion. £23, Feel Unique, Buy it now 9/11 Urban Decay Afterglow 8-Hour Powder Blush in Bang 
With light-diffusing pigments, this long-wearing formula stays streak-free from morning until evening. The red-orange ‘Bang’ shade, ideal for tanned and dark skin tones, looks pretty vibrant in the palette, but can be blended out easily to create a just-right healthy glow. £21, Feel Unique, Buy it now 10/11 Dior Rosy Glow 
For the look of just-pinched cheeks, Dior’s Rosy Glow is unbeatable. The product is designed to react with the moisture in your skin, creating a tailor-made blush that’s instantly noticeable. Its velvety texture also gets a thumbs up. The shiny compact is complete with a handy brush applicator. £31.50, John Lewis, Buy it now 11/11 Bourjois Little Round Pot Blusher in Rose D’Or 
Part of the Bourjois Little Round Pot range, this budget beauty buy has been around for more than 150 years and is still popular as ever. The baked blush is housed in a small-sized pot, which comes with a built-in mirror and a mini fan brush for on-the-go touch-ups. We love that it blends out beautifully even when you’re strapped for time. The Rose D’Or shade is ideal for giving pale skin a delicate lift. £7.99, Superdrug, Buy it now
